content: > you can find the free version of this > pattern on my blog here 1 this > downloadable pdf contains the full > pattern in one ad-free printable > file style meets minimalism in the design of the diana herringbone crochet stitch shawl worked tip to tip this crochet accessory is an easy-to-wear shallow triangular shawl with a modern aesthetic the best thing about this diana herringbone crochet stitch shawl design is its simplicity and the pattern is much easier than it looks it s totally nerflix friendly and you can easy to pick up and put down without having to refer back to the pattern the pattern uses us crochet terminology **materials & tools ** 1 yarn requirements worsted weight yarn in 1 color approx 750m suggested yarn malabrigo yarn rios 100g = 192m 100% merino wool in diana colorway 2 hook size 5mm adjust hook size if necessary to obtain correct gauge 3 tapestry needle to weave and hide yarn ends 4 scissors **level ** intermediate herringbone single_crochet stitch **gauge after blocking ** 17sts x 10rows in 4 /10cm in herringbone crochet stitch gauge is not crucial for this project however changes might result in a different yardage requirements and the finished size **size after blocking ** wingspan 74 /188cm depth 21 5 /54 5 cm **notes ** 1 the shawl is worked in row back and forth using the herringbone crochet stitch 2 worked tip to tip 3 you can use yarn in different weights but be aware that the width will be different depending on your gauge **multi-item discounts** 1 use code **3items** get 15% off when you have 3 items in your cart 2 use code **4items** enjoy 20% off your entire order with 4 items in your cart 3 use code **5items** indulge in a 25% discount when you add 5 items to your cart 4 use code **6items** for the ultimate
